page.title: 08Employment in Tavistock
page.content: Tavistock is a historical, rural, { market town.}It is now a residential area on the edge of Dartmoor. However, in the early 19th century Tavistock was a busy industrial{stannary town} due to the copper, tin and arsenic { mining industry}in Devon & Cornwall. Tavistock has very{little}industry and those it has are very small and therefore employ very few people. This is because it has no major roads or railways. The majority of people working in Tavistock are employed in service industries.{Many residents {have to travel out of Tavistock to {work.} Many people think that the job situation in Tavistock is poor, but others do not agree with more industry because they believe it would spoil the environment and change the atmosphere of the town.
